text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Eligibility period" means the period of weeks consisting of:
the weeks in an individual's benefit year that begin in an extended benefit period; and
if the benefit year ends within the extended benefit period, the weeks after the benefit year that begin in the extended benefit period.

section.section: "Extended benefits" means benefits payable to an individual under this subtitle for weeks of unemployment in the eligibility period of an individual.

"Extended benefits" includes benefits payable to a federal civilian employee or former servicemember under 5 U.S.C. § 8501 et seq. under this subtitle for weeks of unemployment in the eligibility period of the employee or former servicemember.

"Regular benefits" means:
benefits payable to an individual under § 8-808(c) of this title; or
benefits payable to a federal civilian employee or a former servicemember under 5 U.S.C. § 8501 et seq.
"Regular benefits" does not include extended benefits.
